reasons: Air pollution occurs when harmful or excessive quantities of substances are introduced into Earth's atmosphere. Air pollution can have different causes. On one side there are natural causes like natural disasters and on the other side there are man-made causes like traffic or industrial processes.
consequences: The consequences of air pollution are diverse. The environment is encumbered with consequences like climate change. Human beings are mainly encumbered with respiratory disease.
navbarHelp: To switch between the different observed properties click on one of them in the menu. More detailed functions can be selected in the 'More Functions' menu. To view detailed sensor information click on a sensor, a colored circle, on the map. To see interpolated data select the interpolation overlay and click on a point on the map.
popoverMapOverlay: Adds informative objects or coloring to the map depending on the selected overlay. Only one overlay can be selected at a time.
popoverExpertMode: The expert mode offers additional data (for example in the sensor overview) that might be of interest for experts.
popoverHistoricalMode: The historical mode allows you to look back in time. Choose a date and time and press 'Go' to look at the data collected at the time.
popoverColorTheme: Color themes affect the colors used on the website.
popoverColorblindMode: Selecting a different mode can help if you are colorblind. It will affect various parts of our website especially the gradient used to display data.
